intro: Tetrastigma napaulense var. puberulum, commonly known as the hairy climbing raisin vine, is a woody vine native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the grape family, Vitaceae, and is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by edible, raisin-like berries. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found climbing trees or shrubs. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ornamental plant in horticulture.
